abstract.p: Young boy is hit and killed by Amtrak train on elevated section of tracks along Upper West Side of Manhattan (S)

block.p: A young boy was hit and killed by an Amtrak train yesterday evening on an elevated section of tracks along the Upper West Side of Manhattan, the authorities said.

The boy, who the police said was 11 or 12, was hit about 7:40 p.m. near 135th Street and 12th Avenue, an industrial area that is a popular spot for graffiti writers. There were spray cans found near the body, the police said.
A young boy was hit and killed by an Amtrak train yesterday evening on an elevated section of tracks along the Upper West Side of Manhattan, the authorities said.

The boy, who the police said was 11 or 12, was hit about 7:40 p.m. near 135th Street and 12th Avenue, an industrial area that is a popular spot for graffiti writers. There were spray cans found near the body, the police said.
As the train, which originated in Montreal, approached, the engineer saw three children on the tracks, the authorities said.
''The engineer saw them, he tooted his horn, he engaged his brakes,'' said Capt. Thomas E. Cody of the 30th Precinct. ''Unfortunately, he wasn't able to come to a stop in time.''
